posts.post_content:
What if you just tear it in half, tape it back together after the game, put it back in the sleeve, and each time you play just remove the tape to take the pieces apart again? They really should've specified a minimum number of pieces.  
  
But if you're just playing with friends and you want to stay true to the spirit of this without making each other waste money for no reason, I'd suggest something like only being able to use it once every 5 games, or houseruling a drawback like losing 5 life.
posts.html:

Posted By: ratchet1215 (8/31/2009 4:48:42 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: One of the Un-cards that's a funny joke when you see it but completely terribly unfun to actually use. You lose your card, so you only get one shot of fun, unless you're just cheating. The only combo I've seen here with the joke part is *threatening the destruction of other people's cards*, which is ridiculously unfun. And when you're using a better version of the Power 9 in effects, you're probably going to do something massively degenerate and unfun.

Posted By: Tanaka348 (8/12/2011 2:00:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
**Must Read: Best Combo Ever**  
  
There is a HILAROUS combo that I heard of involving a guy that used the [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice) / [March of the Machines](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=March of the Machines) combo. What he did was [Mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindslaver) his opponent, turn all cards in play into copies of [Blacker Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blacker Lotus) using [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave) and activate all of his permanents!  
  
**I don't remember who created that combo, but that man is the best Johnny ever**.  
  
Combo Broken Down For Those Confused:  
1. [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice) makes all permanents artifacts.  
2. [March of the Machines](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=March of the Machines) turns all non-creature artifacts into creatures. ([Blacker Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blacker Lotus) is an artifact creature now)  
3. [Mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindslaver) opponents turn.  
4. During that turn, [Mirrorweave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirrorweave) targeting your [Blacker Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blacker Lotus) creature.  
5. ???  
6. Profit!
posts.html:
Must Read: Best Combo Ever

There is a HILAROUS combo that I heard of involving a guy that used the Mycosynth Lattice / March of the Machines combo. What he did was Mindslaver his opponent, turn all cards in play into copies of Blacker Lotus using Mirrorweave and activate all of his permanents!

I don't remember who created that combo, but that man is the best Johnny ever.

Combo Broken Down For Those Confused:
1. Mycosynth Lattice makes all permanents artifacts.
2. March of the Machines turns all non-creature artifacts into creatures. (Blacker Lotus is an artifact creature now)
3. Mindslaver opponents turn.
4. During that turn, Mirrorweave targeting your Blacker Lotus creature.
5. ???
6. Profit!

Posted By: GlassJoetheChamp (3/23/2012 7:12:11 PM)

posts.post_content:
@Achillesbow  
You're completely missing the point of this card.  
The "rip this up" clause is to encourage you not to play it, whereas anyone would put [Black Lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Lotus) into any deck if they could (ignoring its price and looking at its playability only).  
Think of it this way. You have a few copies of the best card in the game, right? But you have to rip them up to use them. You wouldn't do it.  
You have a copy of [Black lotus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black lotus). Do you play it in your deck and risk your opponent deciding to shuffle for you, and doing it a little roughly? Of course you don't. "IT BELONGS IN A MUSEUM!"  
  
Anyways, SICK [Trinket Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trinket Mage) target. But it doesn't combo with [Auriok Salvagers](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Auriok Salvagers).
